turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Batcave.
turn.2: The newest addition to the cave is "The Bat", a flying tank aircraft built by Wayne Enterprises' Applied Science Division and a Batcomputer as well numerous landing pads and a locking case which contains the Batsuit.
turn.3: What's the most interesting thing in the article?
turn.4: Added features included that the bridges used to gain access to different sections can be submerged as well as the platforms as a form of security measures in case anyone gains unauthorized access to the cave.
turn.5: What else is in the Batcave?
turn.6: While submerged the only visible object is a Batcomputer terminal which can only be accessed by either Bruce or Alfred's fingerprints and an access code.
turn.7: Is there anything else in the Batcave?
turn.8: The cave from "The Dark Knight" appears as well, which contains weapons, supplies, and a back-up Batsuit.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: After Bruce Wayne is declared legally dead, his will is amended so that John Blake inherits GPS coordinates that lead him to the Batcave.
turn.12: In this version, the Batcave is not located directly underneath Wayne Manor, but was originally in the woods on the manor's outskirts, with Bruce discovering the cave when he fell into them after running away during his parents' funeral.
